p: The co-circulation and co-infection of these arboviruses has particular importance when one considers that diseases such as Guillain-Barr√© syndrome (GBS), which has an autoimmune component, are usually triggered by an infectious process [ 71]. GBS has been associated with infection by DENV [ 72], CHIKV [ 73], and ZIKV [ 74] in our country, which could increase the risk of developing the syndrome, the mortality rates, and epidemiological complications. Notably, recent publications with clinical and histopathologic evidence of patients co-infected with DENV/CHIKV demonstrate that there may be an association between mortality and co-infection with these arboviruses [ 75]; moreover, recent articles have demonstrated, both in vitro and in vivo, antibody-dependent potentiation in patients with anti-DENV antibodies who acquire the ZIKV infection [ 76, 77] or vice versa [ 78].
